abstract: NBC Universal’s chief executive said that the company would remain a bidder for the Olympic games in 2014 and 2016.
snippet: NBC Universal’s chief executive said that the company would remain a bidder for the Olympic games in 2014 and 2016.
lead_paragraph: In the months ahead, while Comcast’s bid to gain control of NBC Universal is being reviewed by regulators, General Electric will remain in charge of the media company. The G.E. chief executive, Jeffrey Immelt, said Thursday that G.E. would consult Comcast on occasion over certain deals.

headline.main: NBC Will Continue to Bid for Olympics Rights
